# alicloud\_simple\_application\_server\_custom\_images

This data source provides the Simple Application Server Custom Images of the current Alibaba Cloud user.

-> **NOTE:** Available in v1.143.0+.

## Example Usage

Basic Usage

```python
import constructs as constructs
import cdktf as cdktf
# Provider bindings are generated by running cdktf get.
# See https://cdk.tf/provider-generation for more details.
import ...gen.providers.alicloud as alicloud
class MyConvertedCode(cdktf.TerraformStack):
    def __init__(self, scope, name):
        super().__init__(scope, name)
        data_alicloud_simple_application_server_custom_images_ids =
        alicloud.data_alicloud_simple_application_server_custom_images.DataAlicloudSimpleApplicationServerCustomImages(self, "ids",
            ids=["example_id"]
        )
        data_alicloud_simple_application_server_custom_images_name_regex =
        alicloud.data_alicloud_simple_application_server_custom_images.DataAlicloudSimpleApplicationServerCustomImages(self, "nameRegex",
            name_regex="^my-CustomImage"
        )
        cdktf.TerraformOutput(self, "simple_application_server_custom_image_id_1",
            value=cdktf.property_access(data_alicloud_simple_application_server_custom_images_ids.images, ["0", "id"])
        )
        cdktf.TerraformOutput(self, "simple_application_server_custom_image_id_2",
            value=cdktf.property_access(data_alicloud_simple_application_server_custom_images_name_regex.images, ["0", "id"])
        )
```

## Argument Reference

The following arguments are supported:

* `ids` - (Optional, ForceNew, Computed)  A list of Custom Image IDs.
* `name_regex` - (Optional, ForceNew) A regex string to filter results by Custom Image name.
* `output_file` - (Optional) File name where to save data source results (after running `terraform plan`).

## Argument Reference

The following attributes are exported in addition to the arguments listed above:

* `names` - A list of Custom Image names.
* `images` - A list of Simple Application Server Custom Images. Each element contains the following attributes:
	* `custom_image_id` - The first ID of the resource.
	* `custom_image_name` - The name of the resource.
	* `description` - Image description information.
	* `id` - The ID of the Custom Image.
	* `platform` - The type of operating system used by the Mirror. Valid values: `Linux`, `Windows`.
